alert.note: Alert for Butler; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:03PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN BUTLER AND WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 603 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Trenton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Lebanon, Springboro, Sharonville, Monroe, Loveland, Trenton, Franklin, Carlisle, South Middletown, West Chester, Waynesville, Morrow, Hunter, Kings Island, Olde West Chester and Four Bridges. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 20 and 42. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
